definition-item.definition-title: SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICES NOT COVERED BY CLASS H10 (use of semiconductor devices for measuring G01; resistors in general H01C; magnets, inductors or transformers H01F; capacitors in general H01G; electrolytic devices H01G9/00; batteries or accumulators H01M; waveguides, resonators or lines of the waveguide type H01P; line connectors or current collectors H01R; stimulated-emission devices H01S; electromechanical resonators H03H; loudspeakers, microphones, gramophone pick-ups or like acoustic electromechanical transducers H04R; electric light sources in general H05B; printed circuits, hybrid circuits, casings or constructional details of electrical apparatus, manufacture of assemblages of electrical components H05K; use of semiconductor devices in circuits having a particular application, see the subclass for the application)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
in general

list-item.paragraph-text: discrete and integrated semiconductor devices and
other electric solid state devices (as far as not provided for in another subclass) and
details thereof.

section-body.paragraph-text: This includes the following kind of devices:

list-item.paragraph-text: integrated circuit devices, e.g. CMOS integrated devices, DRAM, EPROM or CCD;
semiconductor devices (e.g. field-effect, bipolar) adapted for rectifying, amplifying, oscillating or switching, e.g. diodes, transistors or thyristors;
semiconductor devices sensitive to radiation, e.g. photo diodes, photo transistors or solar cells;
incoherent light emitting diodes, e.g. LED;
solid state devices using organic materials as the active part or using a combination of organic materials with other materials as the active part, e.g. organic LED or polymer LED;

electric solid state devices using thermoelectric, superconductive, piezoelectric, electrostrictive, magnetostrictive, galvano-magnetic or bulk negative resistance effects, e.g. thermo couples, Peltier elements, Josephson elements, piezo elements;
photo-resistors, magnetic field dependent resistors or field effect resistors;
capacitors having potential barriers or resistors having potential barriers;
thin-film or thick-film circuits;
processes and apparatus adapted for the manufacture or treatment of such devices, except where such processes relate to single step processes for which provision exists elsewhere.

section-body.paragraph-text: Microstructural devices or systems are classified in subclass B81B, and the processes and apparatus specially adapted for the manufacture or treatment thereof are classified in subclass B81C. So, by way of example, microelectro-mechanical devices (MEMS), containing microelectronic and mechanical components, are classified in group B81B7/02, and their manufacture, treatment or assembling in the relevant groups of B81C. Microstructural devices or systems working purely electrically or electronically, or related processes or apparatus for the manufacture or treatment thereof are, however, not covered by B81B or B81C and are classified in section H, for example in the groups of the current subclass H01L.

Microstructural devices or systems being of other than purely electrical or electronically type, and apparatus or processes for the manufacture or treatment thereof, which are normally classified in the subclasses B81B and B81C, may be also classified in those groups of H01L providing for their structural or functional features, whenever such features are of interest per se.

Nanostructures, which are normally classified in subclass B82B, may be also classified in those groups of H01L providing for their structural or functional features, whenever such features are of interest per se.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Use of semiconductor devices for measuring
Waveguides, resonators or lines of the waveguide type
Lasers, stimulated emission devices, e.g. semiconductor laser
Loudspeakers, microphones, gramophone pick-ups or like acoustic electromechanical transducers
Printed circuits, hybrid circuits, casings or constructional details of electric apparatus, manufacture of assemblages of electrical components

table-column.paragraph-text: Containers merely intended for transport or storage of wafers except during manufacture or finishing devices thereon
Conveying systems for semiconductor wafers except during manufacture or treatment of semiconductor or electric solid state devices or components thereon
Processes and apparatus specially adapted for the manufacture or treatment of microstructural devices or systems

Measurement of Mechanical Vibrations or Ultrasonic, Sonic or Infrasonic Waves
Measurement of Intensity, velocity, Spectral, Content, Polarization, Phase or Pulse Characteristic of Infrared, Visible or Ultraviolet Light
Details of scanning-probe apparatus, in general

Radio Direction-Finding; Radio Navigation; Determining Distance or Velocity by Use of Radio Waves; Locating or Presence-Detecting by Use of the Reflection or Reradiation of Radio Waves; Analogous Arrangements Using Other Waves
Systems for Regulating Electrical or Magnetic Variables
Electric discharge tubes or discharge lamps

section-body.paragraph-text: In this subclass, Indexing Codes are mainly attributed with a view to allow retrieval of documents comprising a combination of technical characteristics, some of them being unimportant per se, and, hence, identified as additional information rather than invention information.

In this subclass, both the process and apparatus for the manufacture or treatment of a device and the device itself are classified, whenever both of these are described sufficiently to be of interest.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: the "assembly" of a device is the building up of the device from its component constructional units and includes the provision of fillings in containers.

a "complete device" is a device in its fully assembled state which may or may not require further treatment, e.g. electro-forming, before it is ready for use but which does not require the addition of further structural units.
a "component" is one electric circuit element of a plurality of elements formed in or on a common substrate.

a "container" is an enclosure forming part of the complete device and is essentially a solid construction in which the body of the device is placed, or which is formed around the body without forming an intimate layer thereon.
the term "device" refers to an electric circuit element; where an electric circuit element is one of a plurality of elements formed in or on a common substrate it is referred to as a "component".

"electrodes" are regions in or on the body of the device (other than the solid-state body itself), which exert an influence on the solid-state body electrically, whether or not an external electrical connection is made thereto. An electrode may include several portions and the term includes metallic regions which exert influence on the solid-state body through an insulating region (e.g. capacitive coupling) and inductive coupling arrangements to the body. The dielectric region in a capacitive arrangement is regarded as part of the electrode. In arrangements including several portions only those portions which exert an influence on the solid-state body by virtue of their shape, size or disposition or the material of which they are formed are considered to be part of the electrode. The other portions are considered to be "arrangements for conducting electric current to or from the solid-state body" or "interconnections between solid state components formed in or on a common substrate", i.e. leads.
an "encapsulation" is an enclosure which consists of one or more layers formed on the body and in intimate contact therewith.
an "integrated circuit" is a device where all components, e.g. diodes, resistors, are built up on a common substrate and form the device including interconnections between the components.

processes for the manufacture of at least two different components where the process is especially adapted to their integration, e.g. to take advantage of the integration or to reduce their manufacturing cost. Example: in a CMOS process, the same ion implant dopes the p-MOS gate and the n-MOS source and drain. Consequently, a process for the manufacture of a component per se is not considered as an integration process, even though that component will be part of an integrated circuit.
refers to the arrangement of conductive and insulating regions aimed at electrically connecting the respective electrodes of at least two device units, e.g. two transistors.
the term "parts" includes all structural units which are included in a complete "device".

the expression "solid state body" refers to the body of material within which, or at the surface of which, the physical effects characteristic of the device occur. In thermoelectric devices it includes all materials in the current path.

a "wafer" means a slice of semiconductor or crystalline substrate material, which can be modified by impurity diffusion (doping), ion implantation or epitaxy, and whose active surface can be processed into arrays of discrete devices or integrated circuits.

special-meanings.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used with the meaning indicated:

definition-item.definition-title: Processes or apparatus adapted for the manufacture or treatment of semiconductor or solid state devices or of parts thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes and apparatus that are specially adapted for the manufacturing of semiconductor or solid state devices belonging to the type:

list-item.paragraph-text: Integrated circuit devices, e.g. CMOS integrated devices, DRAM, EPROM, CCD;
Semiconductor devices (e.g. field-effect, bipolar) adapted for rectifying, amplifying, oscillating or switching, e.g. diodes, transistors, thyristors;

section-body.paragraph-text: This main group includes;

list-item.paragraph-text: Manufacture or treatment of the above semiconductor devices or of parts thereof
Manufacture or treatment of solid state devices other than semiconductor devices, or of parts thereof

Apparatus specially adapted for handling semiconductor or electric solid state devices during manufacture or treatment thereof; Apparatus specially adapted for handling wafers during manufacture or treatment of semiconductor or electric solid state devices or components

Manufacture or treatment of devices consisting of a plurality of solid state components formed in or on a common substrate or of parts thereof; manufacture of integrated circuit devices or of parts thereof

Processes for the Electrolytic or Electrophoretic Production of Coatings

Registration or positioning of originals, masks, frames, photographic sheets or textured or patterned surfaces

Processes or apparatus specially adapted for the manufacture or treatment of devices or parts thereof
H10B, H10D, H10F, H10H, H10K or H10N

section-body.paragraph-text: Single mono-steps for which a provision exists elsewhere in CPC need not to be classified in H01L21/00, except if they are specific to the fabrication of semiconductor devices as defined under H01L21/00. E.g., apparatuses which are not specific to the fabrication of these devices, e.g. apparatuses for depositing layers, are classified in C23C or C30B.

Direct pre-treatment or direct post-treatment of a specific step is classified under the specific step if no other place exists in H01L21/00. Example: annealing after layer coating is classified together with the coating. Exception: cleaning, see H01L21/02041
In H01L21/00, poly-silicon is generally considered as a conductive material for classification purposes, except for its deposition (H01L21/02365) where it is considered as semiconducting.
Polishing or chemical-mechanical polishing are not distinguished for classification.
Machines and apparatuses for which a provision exists somewhere else in CPC are not classified In H01L21/00. For example apparatus for deposition of materials are classified in C23C or C30B.
Machines and apparatuses for which no particular provision exists in CPC are classified in H01L21/67 and subgroups. See also the notes under H01L21/67.

Processes mainly consisting of features of the use of the elements of the apparatus and which are necessary to operate said apparatus (like for example rotating the turntable of a polisher, evacuating the chamber of a plasma appraratus etc...) need not to be classified in H01L21/00.

Subject matter relating to processes and apparatus which are clearly suitable for manufacture or treatment of devices whose bodies comprise elements of the fourth group of the Periodic Table (silicon, germanium), and where the material used is not explicitly specified, is classified in the subgroups relating to semiconductors of the fourth group of the Periodic Table (silicon, germanium).

For multistep processes, a junction between two regions of the same material but in a different crystalline state, e.g. amorphous silicon or polysilicon emitters on single crystalline silicon, is not considered as a heterojunction.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: refers to processes wherein only gases or vapours are provided on the surface of a substrate, e.g. a wafer, irrespective of the physical state of the reaction products, gaseous, liquid or solid.
refers to processes wherein only liquids are provided at the surface of a wafer, including the condensation on the surface of a wafer of gaseous components.

direct, for example in situ, treatment, preceding or following a main technological step, aimed at improving said main technological step or its result. Not considered as a technological step per se. Examples: - annealing or crystallisation after deposition of insulating layers, - cleaning before or after a technological step, - modifying an insulating layer just after its formation, e.g. implantation after deposition
Subsequent main technological step. Examples: - patterning or polishing of a layer after deposition- modifying an insulating layer after a step which is not the formation of the insulating layer

definition-item.definition-title: {Preparing wafers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Multi-step processes for the manufacture of semiconductor wafers for the fabrication of semiconductor devices as defined under H01L21/00, prior to the fabrication of any device or part of device, i.e. between the sawing of ingots (covered by B28D) and the cleaning of the wafers (H01L21/02041), e.g. grinding followed by lapping and polishing.
Covers the preparation of bulk semiconductor wafers (e.g. bulk silicon wafers).
See also H10D84/00, which has been used for classifying the fabrication of substrates containing parts of Group-IV and Group AIII-BV semiconductors.
See also C30B33/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Cleaning}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cleaning of wafers before or during manufacturing;

Cleaning is the removal of entities which were always unwanted, like particles, impurities, stringers, fences etc. Also includes the removal of edge beads or unwanted coatings on edges or backside of the wafers etc., except photoresist edge beads and photoresist on backside.
Removal of entities which have had a use or a function (sidewalls, resists etc.) is not considered to be a cleaning.
Includes the removal of natural oxide, see also the section "Special rules for classification within this group" below.
Starts with the deep cleaning carried out before first fabrication step (Piranha-RCA) up to cleaning after singulation.
Rinsing and drying are seen as a post-treatment of a wet cleaning, classified together with wet cleaning in H01L21/02052.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Does not cover the transformation of an impurity or contaminant in something else remaining on the device, e.g. passivation, classified with passivation in general
Processes for the removal of only photoresists, classified in

Does not cover processes for the removal of photoresists edge beads after coating

definition-item.definition-title: {formation by thermal treatment (H01L21/02252 takes precedence; after treatment of an insulating film H01L21/3105 and subgroups)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Formation of insulating layers by plasma treatment, e.g. plasma oxidation of the substrate
After treatment of an insulating film by plasma

definition-item.definition-title: {deposition from the gas or vapour phase}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Deposition methods in which the gas or vapour is produced by physical means, e.g. ablation from targets or heating of source materials.

definition-item.definition-title: {deposition by physical ablation of a target, e.g. sputtering, reactive sputtering, physical vapour deposition or pulsed laser deposition}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Deposition methods in which the gas or vapour is produced by physical means, i.e. by ablation from targets.

definition-item.definition-title: {deposition by thermal evaporation (H01L21/02293 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Deposition methods in which the gas or vapour is produced by heating of source materials.
Molecular beam epitaxy

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Formation of epitaxial insulating films by a deposition method also under

definition-item.definition-title: {deposition by decomposition or reaction of gaseous or vapour phase compounds, i.e. chemical vapour deposition (H01L21/02266 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Deposition by physical ablation of a target, like sputtering, reactive sputtering, physical vapour deposition, pulsed laser deposition

definition-item.definition-title: {deposition by cyclic CVD, e.g. ALD, ALE, pulsed CVD}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Deposition by decomposition or reaction of gaseous or vapour phase compounds in the presence of a plasma (PECVD)

section-body.paragraph-text: Subject matter relating to cyclic plasma CVD is additionally classified in H01L21/02274

definition-item.definition-title: {printing, e.g. ink-jet printing (per se B41J)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {formation of epitaxial layers by a deposition process (epitaxial growth per se C30B)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Formation of non-epitaxial layers by MBE

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the treatment performed before or after the formation of the layer (H01L21/02227 and subgroups take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Treatments, carried out just before or just after the formation of an insulating layer, which do not participate in the formation of the layer itself, but which are directly linked to the layer formation.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processes participating to the formation of a layer, for example oxidation or nitridation of silicon to form an oxide or nitride layer
After treatments like - etching - cleaning - planarising

section-body.paragraph-text: Pre- or post treatments of general nature (pre-, post-cleaning, pre-, post conditioning etc.) without details or routine annealing steps, i.e. thermal treatment without further features as to a special atmosphere, presence of a plasma, thermally induced chemical reactions, change of phase or crystal structure, need not to be given this group symbol.

definition-item.definition-title: {pre-treatment}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Treatments to improve adhesion or change the surface termination

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {in-situ cleaning}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {post-treatment}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The definition should read "post-treatment" instead of after-treatment.
Only covers processes that are part of the layer formation.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: After- treatments performed after completion of the insulating layer

section-body.paragraph-text: Functionalization just after formation should be classified here.
In case the process would also be of interest as an after treatment (H01L21/3105), both group symbols should be given.

definition-item.definition-title: {introduction of substances into an already existing insulating layer (H01L21/02227 and subgroups take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes for introducing substances into the formed insulating layer e.g. introduction of phosphorus into silicon oxide, or introduction of nitrogen into silicon nitride to change stoichiometry.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: For the method of introduction of the dopant

section-body.paragraph-text: Introduction of substances into the formed insulating layer is classified both here and in H01L21/3115

definition-item.definition-title: {into a nitride layer, e.g. changing SiN to SiON}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Oxidation of silicon nitride to form silicon oxynitride.

definition-item.definition-title: {into an oxide layer, e.g. changing SiO to SiON}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Nitridation of silicon oxide to form silicon oxynitride.

definition-item.definition-title: {in-situ cleaning after layer formation, e.g. removing process residues}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Subject matter relating to cleaning processes for semiconductor device fabrication

definition-item.definition-title: {Forming inorganic semiconducting materials on a substrate}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes for the formation of inorganic semiconductors on a substrate.
Processes for forming doped inorganic semiconductors.
In situ pre-and post-treatments of inorganic semiconductor materials.
Processes for the formation of multiple layers of inorganic semiconductors, comprising heterostructures.
The formed semiconductor layer may be crystalline (mono-, poly-, microcrystalline) or amorphous.
Attention is drawn to the groups C23C, C25D, C30B and their subdivisions for general aspects of these techniques.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Nanosized carbon materials, e.g. fullerenes, carbon nanotubes
Processes for forming layers only characterized by the purely chemical aspects of the used precursors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Formation of inorganic semiconductors for light
Processes specially adapted for the manufacture or treatment of organic semiconductor or solid state devices or of parts thereof
Fullerenes used in semiconductor or solid state devices

definition-item.definition-title: {Nanotubes (carbon nanotubes H10K85/211)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carbon nanotubes used in semiconductor or solid state devices

definition-item.definition-title: {Pretreatments (cleaning in general H01L21/02041)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Aftertreatments (planarisation in general H01L21/304)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: After-treatments for improving the planarity of the layers, e.g. thermal smoothening of layers

definition-item.definition-title: {Forming conducting materials on a substrate}

section-body.paragraph-text: This group is not used for classification; subject matter relating to the formation of conductive material on a semiconductor substrate is classified in H01L21/283 - H01L21/288, H01L21/3205 and H01L21/768.

definition-item.definition-title: Making masks on semiconductor bodies for further photolithographic processing not provided for in group H01L21/18 or H01L21/34 {(photographic masks or originals per se G03F1/00; registration or positioning of photographic masks or originals G03F9/00; photographic cameras G03B; control of position G05D3/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Formation of masks to be used for etching or patterning, formed out of a layer formed or deposited on the wafer. Includes inorganic masks (metallic or insulating materials) as well as organic masks.
Composition of photosensitive polymers, see G03F7/00.
Photographic masks of the stencil tape or originals per se: G03F1/00
Registration or positioning of photographic masks or originals: G03F9/00
Photographic cameras G03B
Control of position G05D3/00
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Formation and use of stencil masks
Masks per se, e.g. free standing mask, stencil mask
Formation of photoresist masks per se
Formation of masks for non patterning purposes:

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Photographic masks or originals per se
Registration or positioning of photographic masks or originals

section-body.paragraph-text: In main group H01L21/00 and subgroup thereof, a mask is defined as a layer, which is coated directly onto the surface of the wafer.
A free standing mask (stencil mask) laid on the wafer is not considered as a mask in the sense of H01L21/00.
Masks are classified in H01L21/00 only under the condition that its treatment or structure has been specially adapted to the fabrication of a device covered by H01L21/00. Examples are:

list-item.paragraph-text: masks used for more than one technological step during device fabrication,
masks whose structure, formation or treatment are adapted to the nature of the layers or materials used in the fabrication of semiconductor device, or to the device itself

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising organic layers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Covers polymeric masks, including photo-sensitive masks (photoresist) as well as non photo-sensitive masks, e.g., wax, polyimide etc.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the treatment of photoresist layers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Treatment of photoresist layers peculiar to fabrication of electronic devices.
H01L21/0273 covers the treatment of photoresist which is not peculiar to the type of resist (UV, e-beam, ion beam resist), for example:

list-item.paragraph-text: method of reflowing the resist,
method of hardening the resist

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Photoresists and processing of photoresists in general

list-item.paragraph-text: If the treatment is peculiar to the resist type (light, e-beam or ion-beam resist), then it is classified in the corresponding subgroup. If not, remains in H01L21/0273.
Chemical amplification is considered to be peculiar to the resist type.
fabricating masks by irradiating a resist with different types of radiation, e.g. photons and electrons, the document is classified in H01L21/0273.

definition-item.definition-title: {using an anti-reflective coating (anti-reflective coating for lithography in general G03F7/09)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Anti-reflective coatings specially adapted for devices as defined under H01L21/00.
Covers organic as well as inorganic anti-reflective coatings
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Antireflective coatings for lithography in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Electrolithographic processes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Multilayer structures and special structures adapted to evacuate charges, e.g. multilayer resists with a conductive layer.
Multilayer resists for electrolithography should additionally be classified in G03F7/00.

definition-item.definition-title: {Röntgenlithographic or X-ray lithographic processes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Includes multilayer structures.
Multilayer resists for Röntgenlithography should additionally be classified in G03F7/00

definition-item.definition-title: comprising inorganic layers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes for forming masks comprising inorganic layers.

This group H01L21/033 acts as a head group for inorganic masks for patterning layers. Multiple classification with H01L21/31144 (masks for etching insulating layers), H01L21/32139 (masks for etching conductive layers and polysilicon layers) and H01L21/308 (masks for etching semiconductors) is possible.

definition-item.definition-title: {for lift-off processes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes for forming masks to be used for lifting off another layer (for example having a multilayer structure or special profile) irrespective of their fabrication process
Example:
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lifting off for obtaining the mask

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by their behaviour during the process, e.g. soluble masks, redeposited masks}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Mask having a shape being directly affected by and during the patterning process, e.g. erosion or re-deposition, such that the shape of the mask changes during the patterning process.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the process involved to create the mask, e.g. lift-off masks, sidewalls, or to modify the mask, e.g. pre-treatment, post-treatment}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Processes for forming masks involving special processes, like lift-off, or sidewall formation, e.g. deposition on a step followed by anisotropic etching, or to modify the mask, e.g. oxidation of an Aluminium layer, hardening, before etching step.

definition-item.definition-title: {Process specially adapted to improve the resolution of the mask}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Process specially adapted to provide a mask below the lithographic resolution limit.
Sidewall masks may also be classified in H01L21/0337. As a sidewall spacer has inherently a sub lithographic size, it does not require an automatic group symbol here.

definition-item.definition-title: the devices having potential barriers, e.g. a PN junction, depletion layer or carrier concentration layer

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The group range from H01L21/04 - H01L21/326 covers processes for fabrication of semiconductor devices on substrates belonging to the semiconductors of

list-item.paragraph-text: group IV: Si, Ge,
group IV: carbon, diamond,
group III-V: GaAs, GaN, InP etc.
group IV-IV: Silicon Carbide,
inorganic semiconductors other than the above mentioned materials, e.g. II-VI semiconductors,
bonding or joining semiconductor bodies
diffusion, and alloying of impurities in these semiconductor materials
bombardment of these semiconductor materials with radiation,
Manufacture of electrodes on these semiconductor materials,
special treatments of these semiconductor materials, like

section-body.paragraph-text: thermal treatments, e.g. gettering
electroforming
mechanical treatments of these semiconductor materials
hydrogenation of these materials
treatments of insulating layers formed on these materials, including planarisation, etching,
deposition conductive or resistive layers on these semiconductor materials
treatment of these conductive layers, like planarisation, oxidation, etching, doping,
treatment of the insulating or conductive layers formed thereon,
planarisation of these semiconductor materials, or of the insulating and conductive layers formed thereon
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Formation of insulating layers on semiconductor wafers and the direct post-treatment of this formation
Multistep manufacturing processes for said devices
Multistep manufacturing processes for semiconductor bodies of said devices
Multistep manufacturing processes for electrodes of said devices

section-body.paragraph-text: The presence of a potential jump barrier need not to be specified. Inventions intended to be used in the fabrication of devices having a potential barrier may be classified under H01L21/04.

definition-item.definition-title: {the devices having semiconductor bodies comprising semiconducting carbon, e.g. diamond, diamond-like carbon}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Passivation of semiconducting carbon, e.g. diamond
This place does not cover:

Processes for fabricating devices having bodies of diamond not covered by H01L21/041 - H01L21/0425 are classified in H01L21/18 - H01L21/326 and are also mandatoril y classified in H10D62/8303 as invention information or additional information whenever appropriate.

definition-item.definition-title: {the devices having semiconductor bodies comprising crystalline silicon carbide}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

Processes for fabricating devices having bodies comprising crystalline silicon carbide not covered by H01L21/045 - H01L21/048 are classified in H01L21/18 - H01L21/326 and are also mandatorily classified in H10D62/8325 as invention information or additional information whenever appropriate.

definition-item.definition-title: {using ion implantation}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes where ion implantation of boron and subsequent annealing does produce a p-doped region in a silicon carbide.
Processes where ion implantation of boron and subsequent annealing does not produce a p-doped region are classified elsewhere, e.g. H01L21/0445

definition-item.definition-title: the devices having semiconductor bodies comprising elements of Group IV of the Periodic Table or AIIIBV compounds with or without impurities, e.g. doping materials {(H01L21/041 - H01L21/0425, H01L21/045 - H01L21/048 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Processes and apparatus which, by using the appropriate technology, are clearly suitable for manufacture or treatment of devices whose bodies comprise elements of the fourth group of the Periodic Table or AIII-BV compounds, even if the material used is not explicitly specified.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making n- or p-doped regions for devices having semiconductor bodies of diamond; Changing their shape; Making electrodes
Making n- or p-doped regions for devices having semiconductor bodies comprising crystalline silicon carbide; Changing their shape; Making electrodes; Passivating silicon carbide surfaces

definition-item.definition-title: {Joining of semiconductor bodies for junction formation}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Joining through a metal layer or eutectic layer.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joining/bonding of semiconductor bodies through an oxide layer

definition-item.definition-title: {by direct bonding}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Direct bonding of semiconductor bodies without intermediate layer

definition-item.definition-title: Diffusion of impurity materials, e.g. doping materials, electrode materials, into or out of a semiconductor body, or between semiconductor regions; {Interactions between two or more impurities; Redistribution of impurities}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Plasma doping.

Plasma doping is considered as doping from a gas phase, as is the case in Plasma Immersion Ion Implantation. Nevertheless, plasma doping can have ion implantation aspects like the type of ions. These aspects should be classified in ion implantation, H01L21/265. But a group symbol e.g. H01L21/2236 or an index code e.g. H01L21/2236 should always be allocated to track the fact it uses a plasma.

definition-item.definition-title: using diffusion into or out of a solid from or into a gaseous phase {(H01L21/221 - H01L21/222 take precedence; diffusion through an applied layer H01L21/225)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: using diffusion into or out of a solid from or into a solid phase, e.g. a doped oxide layer {(H01L21/221 - H01L21/222 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {from or through or into an applied layer, e.g. photoresist, nitrides}

section-body.paragraph-text: In the range H01L21/2254 - H01L21/2257 the main compositional part of the applied layer just before the diffusion step has to be considered for classification

definition-item.definition-title: using diffusion into or out of a solid from or into a liquid phase, e.g. alloy diffusion processes {(H01L21/221 - H01L21/222 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Alloying of impurity materials, e.g. doping materials, electrode materials, with a semiconductor body {(H01L21/182 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Intermixing, interdiffusion or disordering of AIII-BV heterostructures

definition-item.definition-title: Bombardment with radiation {(H01L21/3105 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bombardment with radiation as post-treatment of an insulating layer

definition-item.definition-title: with high-energy radiation (H01L21/261 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: High energy radiation creating a nuclear transmutation

section-body.paragraph-text: There is no exact border defining high energy. It is meant to cover alpha, beta, gamma, Röntgen... rays. The sub group H01L21/2633 is incorrectly placed as a subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: producing ion implantation

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Thermal treatment for modifying the properties of semiconductor bodies per se
Ion beam tubes for localised treatment

definition-item.definition-title: using masks {(H01L21/26586 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Crystal planes or main crystal surface and ion beam present an angle

definition-item.definition-title: Manufacture of electrodes on semiconductor bodies using processes or apparatus not provided for in groups H01L21/20 - H01L21/268

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Includes processes for forming

list-item.paragraph-text: conductor-semiconductor,
conductor-insulator-semiconductor, or
conductor-insulator-conductor-insulator-semiconductor structures.

section-body.paragraph-text: Multistep processes for manufacturing electrodes on semiconductor bodies characterised by

list-item.paragraph-text: a sequence of single steps, possibly including steps like deposition conductive material, alloying, silicidation,
the structure or the shape of the electrode.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Physical or chemical etching of the layers
Depositing or patterning electrodes for capacitors
Manufacturing electrodes for devices having potential barriers

section-body.paragraph-text: Formation of electrodes only involving an etching of conductive materials, including silicide on polysilicon: H01L21/3213 and subgroups.
Information peculiar to single-step processes should also be classified in the corresponding group, e.g.

list-item.paragraph-text: H01L21/311 or H01L21/3213 for etching,
H01L21/3105 or H01L21/321 for planarising.

definition-item.definition-title: {Making conductor-insulator-semiconductor electrodes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes for the fabrication of conductor-insulator-semiconductor structure, e.g. wherein the conductor is part of the interconnect (gate level interconnect).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Monosteps for forming insulators or conductors for which the application to gate electrodes is mentioned without further details.

definition-item.definition-title: {the insulator being formed after the semiconductor body, the semiconductor being silicon}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Deposition of the insulators, using epitaxiy
Deposition of the conductor and the insulator within the same process chamber.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the conductor (H01L21/28176 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Annealing, after the formation of the definitive gate conductor

section-body.paragraph-text: When the final conductor comprises a superconductor, subject matter is not classified according to H01L21/28035 - H01L21/28097, but instead it is classified in H01L21/28026.

definition-item.definition-title: {the final conductor layer next to the insulator being silicon, e.g. polysilicon, with or without impurities (H01L21/28105 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: the final conductor next to the insulator having a lateral composition or doping variation, or being formed laterally by more than one deposition step

section-body.paragraph-text: A very thin, e.g. silicon, adhesion or seed layer is not considered as the one next to the insulator

definition-item.definition-title: {the conductor comprising a silicide layer formed by the silicidation reaction of silicon with a metal layer (formed by metal ion implantation H01L21/28044)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Silicide formed by metal ion implantation

section-body.paragraph-text: To assess the coverage of groups H01L21/28052 and H01L21/28061, barrier layers, e.g. TaSiN, are not considered]

definition-item.definition-title: {the conductor comprising a metal or metal silicide formed by deposition, e.g. sputter deposition, i.e. without a silicidation reaction (H01L21/28052 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Conductors comprising a silicide layer formed by the silicidation reaction of silicon with a metal layer

section-body.paragraph-text: To assess the coverage of groups H01L21/28052 and H01L21/28061, barrier layers, e.g. TaSiN, are not considered]

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the sectional shape, e.g. T, inverted-T}

section-body.paragraph-text: Documents are also classified in groups H01L21/28035 - H01L21/28105 when the composition is also relevant

definition-item.definition-title: {Lithography-related aspects, e.g. sub-lithography lengths; Isolation-related aspects, e.g. to solve problems arising at the crossing with the side of the device isolation; Planarisation aspects}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fabrication of lithographic masks for electrodes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Making the insulator}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Forming insulating materials on a substrate

section-body.paragraph-text: In case the formation of the insulator would be of general interest, a group symbol should be given in H01L21/02107.

definition-item.definition-title: {with a treatment, e.g. annealing, after the formation of the gate insulator and before the formation of the definitive gate conductor}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

definition-item.definition-title: {in a gaseous ambient using an oxygen or a water vapour, e.g. RTO, possibly through a layer (H01L21/28194 and H01L21/28202 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Evaporation, ALD, CVD, sputtering, laser deposition
Nitride deposition, growth, oxynitridation, NH3 nitridation, N2O oxidation, thermal nitridation, RTN, plasma nitridation, RPN

section-body.paragraph-text: Thin oxidation layers used as a barrier layer or as a buffer layer, e.g. before the fomation of a high-k insulator, are classified here only if important per se.

definition-item.definition-title: {by deposition of a layer, e.g. metal, metal compound or poysilicon, followed by transformation thereof into an insulating layer}

section-body.paragraph-text: In case the transformation would be of general interest it should be classified in

definition-item.definition-title: Deposition of conductive or insulating materials for electrodes {conducting electric current}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
H01L21/283 - H01L21/2885 cover the deposition of conductive layers directly in contact with the semiconductor for forming electrodes.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Formation of electrodes of capacitors, resistors, inductors
Formation of electrodes of semiconductor devices

section-body.paragraph-text: Application to contacts must be mentioned with details. Moreover, details of deposition processes of conductive layers covered by H01L21/3205 are additionally classified in this group and subgroups thereof. If a document discloses information relevant for any of the groups H01L21/768 - H01L21/76898, one or more of these groups should also be assigned.

definition-item.definition-title: from a gas or vapour, e.g. condensation

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Methods for depositing conductive layers using gases or vapours of metals or metal-containing precursors.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Deposition of polysilicon in contact with a semiconductor
Formation of electrodes of capacitors, resistors, inductors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chemical coating by decomposition of gaseous compounds, without leaving reaction products of surface material in the coating, i.e. chemical vapour deposition (CVD) processes

section-body.paragraph-text: The deposition process (PVD, CVD, ALD etc.) must be specially adapted for forming contacts or interconnects within semiconductor devices and must be disclosed in detail, i.e. include details on deposition parameters, precursor materials, particular apparatus details etc.
If a document discloses information relevant for any of the groups H01L21/768 - H01L21/76898, one or more of these groups should also be assigned.

definition-item.definition-title: {the conductive layers comprising semiconducting material (H01L21/28518, H01L21/28537 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Deposition of polysilicon on silicon classified there only if application to contacts is mentioned. Otherwise H01L21/02365

definition-item.definition-title: {Making of side-wall contacts}

section-body.paragraph-text: Deposition of polysilicon on silicon classified there only if application to contacts is mentioned. Otherwise H01L21/02365

definition-item.definition-title: from a liquid, e.g. electrolytic deposition

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The deposition of conductive layers directly in contact with semiconductors for forming electrodes using liquid deposition techniques, e.g. electroless plating.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Formation of electrodes of capacitors, resistors, inductors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chemical coating by decomposition of either liquid compounds or solutions of the coating forming compounds, without leaving reaction products of surface material in the coating

section-body.paragraph-text: The deposition process must be specially adapted for forming contacts or interconnects within semiconductor devices and must be disclosed in detail, i.e. include details on deposition parameters, precursor materials, particular apparatus details etc.
If a document discloses information relevant for any of the groups H01L21/768 - H01L21/76898, one or more of these groups should also be assigned.

definition-item.definition-title: Treatment of semiconductor bodies using processes or apparatus not provided for in groups H01L21/20 - H01L21/26 (manufacture of electrodes thereon H01L21/28)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: mechanical treatments, like grinding, sand blasting etc.
hydrogenation of these semiconductors
chemical treatments, like etching,

formation of insulating layers and after treatment of these layers, like planarisation, etching, formation of conductive layers on these insulating layers and after treatment of these conductive layers and their doping.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Mechanical treatment, e.g. grinding, polishing, cutting {(H01L21/30625 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Mechanical treatment of semiconductor wafers or semiconductor layers, except the mechanical treatment of insulating or conductive layers on semiconductor wafers.
Mechanical treatment in general:

list-item.paragraph-text: grinding, polishing B24B,
abrasive blasting B24C

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Polishing of epitaxial layers on semiconductor wafers
Single step mechanical operations, like sawing, polishing, breaking etc. classified in the corresponding group in section B

section-body.paragraph-text: The mere use of a machine is classified with the machine only.

Process for the mechanical treatment, enhanced by chemical treatment, is classified in chemical treatment, but may be given a group symbol in mechanical treatment if the mechanical treatment itself is of importance for the invention.
Purely mechanical polishing is considered as chemical-mechanical polishing, and is classified accordingly.

definition-item.definition-title: {Making grooves, e.g. cutting}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Making grooves, which may result in cutting
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Chemical or electrical treatment, e.g. electrolytic etching (to form insulating layers H01L21/31)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Chemical or electrical treatment of group IV or III-V semiconductors.
Formation of porous semiconductors,
Functionalisation of semiconductor surfaces

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chemical or electrical treatment to form insulating layers

definition-item.definition-title: {Anisotropic liquid etching (H01L21/3063 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Anisotropic liquid etching, i.e. "crystal orientation dependant" etching, using basic (pH>7) compositions. The etch composition is often composed of KOH, amines, azines, quaternary ammonium compounds
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Vapour phase etching}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Reactive Ion Etching [RIE] of III-V

definition-item.definition-title: {With simultaneous mechanical treatment, e.g. mechanico-chemical polishing}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes for polishing semiconductors not being part of the sequence for preparing wafers from an ingot (H01L21/02013 or H01L21/02024).
Covers polishing or CMP of semiconductor layers deposited on a substrate, like epitaxial layers.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Polishing or CMP of bulk wafers, wherein the polishing is part of the sequence for preparing wafers from an ingot
Polishing or CMP of insulating layers
Polishing or CMP of conductive layers

section-body.paragraph-text: Chemical-mechanical polishing also includes purely mechanical polishing.

definition-item.definition-title: Electrolytic etching

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: formation of porous materials by electrolysis

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Plasma etching; Reactive-ion etching

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: sputter etching,
particle (electron, ion, photon) beam enhanced etching
light assisted etching.
plasma etching
dry etching, i.e. using an etching gas without plasma

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reactive ion etching of III-V materials

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Laser etching without reactive atmosphere per se

definition-item.definition-title: using masks (H01L21/3063, H01L21/3065 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Masks used for patterning semiconductors of group IV or III-V, including masks used for plasma etching/patterning, excepted masks for electrolytic etching.
The fabrication of masks to be used for etching or patterning semiconductors (non-monocrystalline semiconductors being excluded).

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Formation of masks for non patterning purposes, which are classified with the step in question: - masks for implantation - masks for forming insulating layers, - masks for selective growth, - masks for patterning semiconductors belonging to groups other than group IV and group III-V.
Formation and use of stencil masks
Free standing masks, e.g. stencil masks
Formation of photoresist masks per se, except if the formation of the photoresist mask is specific to the device to be fabricated or semiconductor substrate

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: General masks for patterning in the fabrication of semiconductor device
Masks for patterning conductors, including polycrystalline or amorphous silicon

section-body.paragraph-text: A mask in H01L21/00 is formed of a layer coated directly onto the surface of the wafer.
A free standing mask (stencil mask) laid on the wafer is not considered as a mask in the sense of H01L21/00.
Masks are classified in H01L21/308 only under the condition that its treatment or structure has been specially adapted to the fabrication of a device covered by H01L21/00. Examples are:

list-item.paragraph-text: masks used for more than one technological step during device fabrication,
masks whose structure, formation or treatment are adapted to the nature of the layers or materials used in the fabrication of semiconductor device, or to the device itself

section-body.paragraph-text: The takes precedence rule (stemming from IPC) pointing to H01L21/3065 is not valid for CPC: masks for etching by plasma or reactive ion etching are given a group symbol here.
Masks for electrolytic etching are classified with the electrochemical etching in H01L21/3063.
Using stencil masks for ion implantation is classified in H01L21/266.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by their behaviour during the process, e.g. soluble masks, redeposited masks}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Masks having a specific behaviour during etching process. e.g. erodible mask, shrinking mask etc.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processes wherein the etching is interrupted to modify the mask (sequential etching), e.g. etching, followed by modifying the mask, followed by re-etching, with possible cycling of the above steps

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the process involved to create the mask, e.g. lift-off masks, sidewalls, or to modify the mask, e.g. pre-treatment, post-treatment}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Covers pre-treatment for the formation of a mask, post treatment of the mask before etching, treatments to modify the mask before use, e.g. hardening, formation of sidewalls, multiple sidewalls etc.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Modification of the mask during etching
Removal of the mask after use

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Process specially adapted to improve the resolution of the mask}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Process specially adapted to go below resolution limit of lithography.

definition-item.definition-title: to form insulating layers thereon, e.g. for masking or by using photolithographic techniques (encapsulating layers H01L21/56); After treatment of these layers; Selection of materials for these layers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes for forming insulating layers and their direct post-treatment.
To be used in any process, formation of interconnects, isolation oxides etc.when the invention is focussed on the insulator.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insulating layers forming part of electrodes

definition-item.definition-title: After-treatment

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Covers special treatments of insulating layers, wherein the special treatment is not a post-treatment as defined under H01L21/00, i.e. the classical annealing of the insulating layer to improve its characteristics, but is for example
planarisation, patterning, functionalization after etching.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Classical annealing after formation of the insulator, classified together with the formation

section-body.paragraph-text: Functionalization just after formation should be classified with the formation.
In case the process would also be of interest as a post treatment, both classes should be given.

definition-item.definition-title: {Planarisation of the insulating layers (H01L21/31058 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Planarisation of insulating layers.
Atomic scale planarisation (smoothening) of the insulating layers.
Reflow of insulating layers.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: After treatment, e.g. planarisation, of organic layers

definition-item.definition-title: {involving a dielectric removal step}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Planarisation involving a removal step not being a chemical etch step: this is the group for polishing and chemical-mechanical polishing (CMP) of insulating materials.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {the removal being a chemical etching step, e.g. dry etching (etching per se H01L21/311)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Planarisation by non selective etching, e.g. by a blanket etching reducing the protrusions.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {the removal being a selective chemical etching step, e.g. selective dry etching through a mask}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes where protrusions are selectively etched through a mask.

definition-item.definition-title: {Etching inorganic layers}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {by chemical means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Etching by wet process, or by processes wherein gaseous reactants are condensed on the surface.
Gaseous etch with HF is classified in H01L21/31116

definition-item.definition-title: {by dry-etching}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Plasma etching
Ion beam etching

definition-item.definition-title: {Etching organic layers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Removal of organic layers or polymers, including photoresists peculiar to semiconductor wafers or devices.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: The removal of silicon-containing compounds having an organic nature.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Removal of photoresist not peculiar to semiconductor wafers

section-body.paragraph-text: Removal of photoresist being not peculiar to semiconductors is classified in G03F7/42.
Peculiar to semiconductor devices means that particular precautions are taken to avoid influence of the removal of the photoresist on the semiconductor wafer or device.

definition-item.definition-title: {by chemical means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Etching by wet process, or by processes wherein gaseous reactants are condensed on the surface.

definition-item.definition-title: {using masks}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Etching involving a specially adapted mask
In case the mask would be of general interest, it should also be classified in H01L21/033

definition-item.definition-title: Doping the insulating layers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: See also after treatment of insulating layers
Doping with the purpose to alter resistivity or increase conductivity

section-body.paragraph-text: Implantation or diffusion into insulating layers is also classified under H01L21/02318 and subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: Organic layers, e.g. photoresist (H01L21/3105, H01L21/32 take precedence; {photoresists per se G03C})

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
H01L21/312 - H01L21/3128 are no longer used for classification of new documents, see H01L21/02112.

definition-item.definition-title: Inorganic layers (H01L21/3105, H01L21/32 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: H01L21/314 - H01L21/3185 are no longer used for classification of new documents. See H01L21/02112.

definition-item.definition-title: Deposition of non-insulating-, e.g. conductive- or resistive-, layers on insulating layers; After-treatment of these layers (manufacture of electrodes H01L21/28)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Deposition of conductive layers exclusively on insulating layers, when the process of deposition is relevant.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Deposition of conductive layers on semiconductor

section-body.paragraph-text: When the technique of deposition is particular (CVD, PVD or electroplating), also classify in H01L21/283, H01L21/285 or H01L21/288. When an interconnection is concerned, see also H01L21/768 and subgroups.

definition-item.definition-title: After treatment

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Treatment of formed conductive layers. Includes:

list-item.paragraph-text: etching by chemical or physical means,
planarisation, including chemical-mechanical polishing,
oxidation, nitridation, or surface treatment,
doping.

section-body.paragraph-text: Polysilicon, amorphous silicon and silicides are considered as conductive materials for these groups.
Polysilicon, amorphous silicon and silicides are considered as conductive materials for these groups. After treatment of layers of these materials is thus classified here.
For classifying in the group range H01L21/321 - H01L21/3215, the explicit presence of an insulating layer below the conductive or resistive layers is not mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: {Oxidation of silicon-containing layers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Oxidation of non-monocrystalline silicon, e.g. polycrystalline, microcrystalline or amorphous silicon.
This place does not cover:
Polysilicon, amorphous silicon and silicides are considered as conductive materials for these groups. Oxidation of layers of these materials is thus classified here.
For classifying in the group range H01L21/321 - H01L21/3215, the presence of an insulating layer below the conductive or resistive layers is not mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: {Nitridation of silicon-containing layers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Nitridation of non-monocrystalline silicon, e.g. polycrystalline, microcrystalline or amorphous silicon.
This place does not cover:
Polysilicon, amorphous silicon and silicides are considered as conductive materials for these groups. Nitridation of layers of these materials is thus classified here.
For classifying in the group range H01L21/321 - H01L21/3215, the explicit presence of an insulating layer below the conductive or resistive layers is not mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: {Planarisation}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Planarisation of conductive or resistive layers.
Polysilicon, amorphous silicon and silicides are considered as conductive materials for these groups. Planarisation of these layers is thus classified here.
For classifying in the group range H01L21/321 - H01L21/3215, the explicit presence of an insulating layer below the conductive or resistive layers is not mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: {by chemical mechanical polishing [CMP]}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Physical or chemical etching of the layers, e.g. to produce a patterned layer from a pre-deposited extensive layer

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Physical or chemical etching of conductive or resistive layers.
Etching of polysilicon layers
Etching of amorphous silicon layers
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines or apparatus for liquid etching

section-body.paragraph-text: Polysilicon, amorphous silicon and silicides are considered as conductive materials for these groups. Etching of layers of these materials is thus classified here.
For classifying in the group range H01L21/321 - H01L21/3215, the explicit presence of an insulating layer below the conductive or resistive layers is not mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: {by physical means only}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Etching processes, where no chemical reaction is involved, e.g.
sputtering, ion milling, laser ablation, pure ion beam etching.
For classifying in the group range H01L21/321 - H01L21/3215, the explicit presence of an insulating layer below the conductive or resistive layers is not mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: {of silicon-containing layers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Silicides and silicon alloys.

definition-item.definition-title: {by chemical means only}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Use of Plasmas, e.g. RIE, and chemically assisted particle (ion or electron, photon) beam etching
For classifying in the group range H01L21/321 - H01L21/3215, the explicit presence of an insulating layer below the conductive or resistive layers is not mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: {by liquid etching only}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Etching with supercritical fluids

definition-item.definition-title: {using plasmas}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Etching assisted by electrons, ions and laser beams.

definition-item.definition-title: {of silicon-containing layers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Polysilicon, amorphous, silicides, multilayers containing silicon

definition-item.definition-title: {pre- or post-treatments, e.g. anti-corrosion processes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Pre-treatments before etching, including removal of natural oxide.
Anti-corrosion post-treatments.
This place does not cover:
In case the pre-treatment is a removal of natural oxide and is of general interest, a group symbol in H01L21/02041 should be given.
In case the post treatment is a passivation by oxidation or nitridation this step should be classified independently.
For classifying in the group range H01L21/321 - H01L21/3215, the explicit presence of an insulating layer below the conductive or resistive layers is not mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: {using masks}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Etching involving a mask specifically adapted to the etching operation.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Classical photoresist masks, except if submitted to a special treatment, for example hardening, fluorination, etc.

section-body.paragraph-text: In case the mask would be of general interest, it should also be classified in H01L21/033.
For classifying in the group range H01L21/321 - H01L21/3215, the explicit presence of an insulating layer below the conductive or resistive layers is not mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: Doping the layers

section-body.paragraph-text: Polysilicon, amorphous silicon and silicides are considered as conductive materials for these groups. Doping of these layers is thus classified here.
For classifying in the group range H01L21/321 - H01L21/3215, the explicit presence of an insulating layer below the conductive or resistive layers is not mandatory.

definition-item.definition-title: to modify their internal properties, e.g. to produce internal imperfections

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Treatments aimed at modifying the intrinsic properties of the crystals not otherwise provided for in H01L21/00, like crystallographic defect rate.
Formation of defects for intrinsic or extrinsic gettering

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {of silicon bodies, e.g. for gettering}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Extrinsic gettering
Gettering using both extrinsic and intrinsic gettering techniques is classified in both H01L21/3221 and H01L21/3225.

definition-item.definition-title: {Thermally inducing defects using oxygen present in the silicon body for intrinsic gettering (H01L21/3226 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Intrinsic gettering
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Treatment of semiconductor bodies to modify their internal properties of silicon on insulator

section-body.paragraph-text: Gettering using both extrinsic and intrinsic gettering techniques is classified in both H01L21/3221 and H01L21/3225.

definition-item.definition-title: the devices having semiconductor bodies not provided for in groups H01L21/18, H10D48/04 and H10D48/07, with or without impurities, e.g. doping materials

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes for fabricating devices having semiconductor bodies not belonging to group IV, IV-IV, III-V materials, or to Se, Te, CuO.
Processes for fabricating devices having semiconductor bodies based on II-VI materials.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Group II-IV active materials for radiation sensitive devices
Group II-IV active materials for light-emitting devices

definition-item.definition-title: Diffusion of impurity materials, e.g. doping materials, electrode materials, into or out of a semiconductor body, or between semiconductor regions

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Doping of II-VI materials.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Semiconductor bodies composed of II-VI compounds for light sensitive devices

definition-item.definition-title: Bombardment with radiation

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Radiation covers corpuscular as well as electromagnetic radiation
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bombardment with radiation for deposition purposes
Bombardment with radiation for etching purposes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ion beam tubes for localized treatment

definition-item.definition-title: using masks

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes for implantation wherein the invention is focused on the mask aspect, e.g. mask having a specific topography.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Manufacture of electrodes on semiconductor bodies using processes or apparatus not provided for in groups H01L21/38 - H01L21/428

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Electrodes on semiconductor materials as defined under H01L21/34.
Covers the direct deposition of conductive materials on the semiconductor and on an insulating layer overlying the semiconductor (e.g. Tunnel contact).
The group H01L21/44 includes specific treatments of the semiconductor before formation of the contact (e.g. degenerescence by bombardment etc.).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: semiconductor materials of group IV or III-V

definition-item.definition-title: Deposition of conductive or insulating materials for electrodes

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Insulating materials, only if the contact is a tunnelling contact.

definition-item.definition-title: from a liquid, e.g. electrolytic deposition

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Electrolytic deposition
Electroless deposition

definition-item.definition-title: involving the application of pressure, e.g. thermo-compression bonding

section-body.paragraph-text: Classification is made in this group only if specific to the semiconductor material, or adapted to the type of device.

definition-item.definition-title: involving the application of mechanical vibrations, e.g. ultrasonic vibrations

section-body.paragraph-text: Classification is made in this group only if specific to the semiconductor material, or adapted to the type of device.

definition-item.definition-title: Treatment of semiconductor bodies using processes or apparatus not provided for in groups H01L21/428 (manufacture of electrodes thereon H01L21/44)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The treatment of semiconductor bodies including

list-item.paragraph-text: mechanical treatments, like grinding, sand blasting etc.
chemical treatments, like etching,

after-treatments of these semiconductors, like formation of insulating layers, planarisation or etching of these insulating layers, formation of conductive layers on these insulating layers and after treatment of these conductive layers and their doping.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Chemical or electrical treatment, e.g. electrolytic etching (to form insulating layers H01L21/469)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chemical or electrical treatment to form insulating layers thereon

definition-item.definition-title: using masks

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Masks used for patterning group IV and group III-V semiconductors

definition-item.definition-title: to form insulating layers thereon, e.g. for masking or by using photolithographic techniques (encapsulating layers H01L21/56); After-treatment of these layers
